reviews.text: We have stayed here twice off-season when rates were very reasonable. But this is a near waterfront location in a delightful little town - home of the famous Rock - so expect it to be both full and expensive during peak season. The service is friendly with welcome cookies sometimes and coffee in the lobby. It has a restaurant - not sure why as there are five restaurants within a five minute walk. The bar is intimate with live music on the Friday we were there and decent food. Rooms are large and some have glimpses of the sea although the property is set back a way from the ocean front. It has a pool and fitness centre. Good for kids, great convenient location for the Cape and Boston.
reviews.title: Lovely location

reviews.text: My wife and I brought my three young sons to Plymouth to introduce them to Plimouth Plantation and the birthplace of New England. All five of us shared one room. While the prospect initially was dubious, it turned out to be better than we could have imagined. The accommodations were superb. Having access to an indoor, heated pool made my kids very happy, and it allowed them to work off that extra energy that little boys always seem to have even at the close of a long, busy day. The beds were extremely comfortable. The service, food in the restaurant and from room service, and location of the hotel were all perfect. The staff went out of their way above and beyond to be helpful. After having been all over Europe and the U.S. and having stayed in many hotels, this was certainly one of the best experiences we've ever had.
reviews.title: Family trip to Plymouth

reviews.text: The staff here was very helpful in light of my special needs. I have severe Allergys and Asthma. We had booked this hotel from Germany where we live and planned on staying in the center of Plymouth; however, as we looked in the rooms I noticed the cleaner used was causing a reaction for me. The staff were very helpful and showed us several other rooms in the hope of finding one that would work for me. Since we could not find one, the staff was very nice and let us out of the reservation. Wonderful and verry helpful staff! Great location!
reviews.title: It didn't work for us.

reviews.text: Let me start with saying that we only paid $79/night and we are here off season. We got that deal on their website and prepaid for 3 nights. The hotel is not on the water and you can't see the bay unless you get a room up high (have to pay extra). We are on the "second" which is really the main floor all the way in the back so the view is if the parking lot but we are not staying here for the view. THE POOL is warm and it goes to 8ft deep so little ones and do cannon balls but no diving. The hot tub does not work but it is still very hot and relaxing. there are chairs and tables everywhere so perfect places to bring a book and read. The main restaurant is not open (March) so we had our first dinner in the pub. The seafood pizza and the cod sandwich was really good! (I am from LI and NJ and I know seafood)
reviews.title: Perfect family hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are staying in a King room and it is a sleep number which does take a night to figure out (its an air mattress) But the room itself is nice and big with a pull out bed couch and a nice size flat screen TV. Its not a modern 4 star hotel so there is some décor mishaps, but other than that the room is very clean.
reviews.title: great little getaway
Just ok, if no better choices this place is alright
reviews.text: This hotel is just what you would expect at a somewhat dated, conference/business type property. Whatever you do stay away from rooms/suites that face the indoor pool....NIGHTMARE. The rooms smell like chlorine and running the loud AC all night is a must since the humidity that comes from the pool makes the room's temperature unbearable.
Rooms that actually face the outside (which we moved to) are much better but overall the place seems old despite the Sleep Number beds (which we were not fans of).
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: If you have no other (better?) options stay here but don't expect anything special and certainly don't set yourself up to have a good breakfast if it is included in your package.
reviews.title: Gordon Ramsey come rescue this hotel!
Friendly Staff
reviews.text: We have four expectations of a hotel: room size, cleanliness, water pressure (too many time have stood under a dribble of water and felt filthy all day) and good wifi. All were met! Plus great location and friendly staff.

I attended a conference at this hotel this past weekend. I had read the Trip Advisor reports and opted to sleep at another property. The hotel is very dated to say the least and felt dirty because of it. I couldn’t believe the number of folks that choose to have their weddings here. Honestly the whole property needs a make over badly.
reviews.title: Fabulous Wedding Experience

reviews.text: From the outside, this is not a pretty hotel. But the service is very good; they are very nice people trying to help you have a pleasant time. The rooms are clean and pleasant. The Swimming pool is inside in a very hot rather airless space and we ended up not using it; it would be a great area to redo. There is a good restaurant in the hotel which we thought had very good food and made the trip much more convenient to be able to rely on this.
reviews.title: service

reviews.text: We stayed here for a wedding this past weekend, and noticed that the hotel seems to be pretty run down. They don't have enough outlets to plug things into, the ones they do have are either hanging out of the wall, or don't work, the towel rack in the bathroom was hanging off of the wall, and the rooms just have sort of a musty smell to them. I don't think they really care about fixing these things, because we actually stayed here for our own wedding in September, and it was the same way. It is probably because they are they only real hotel on the water front, so if somebody wants to stay at a better hotel like the Hilton, then they are going to be further away from the historic parts of Plymouth.
reviews.title: Dirty place

reviews.text: I almost gave this hotel 5 stars. For a 3 star property it is very nice. Overall, we had a great stay.
reviews.title: One star off for wild pool area.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Good:
reviews.title: Great over-night for Wedding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are attractive. The furniture is nice, the bed linens are plush and the pillows are good. Everything was clean. The beds are "sleep number" which was fun to try out. The art on the walls and painted murals are lovely. We had a peak of the ocean from our window.
reviews.title: Saved our weekend!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I stayed over the Memorial Day weekend. We arrived an hour early after departing Capt. John's Whale Watching tour and were greeted by friendly courteous staff. I chose a room on the 4th floor with balcony and water view. The key didnt work in the first room and they were very prompt in changing our room . I chose this location as it was walking distance to the whale watch tours and all the buzz of this lovely little sea-side town. The room was average but the bed was a super comfortable pillow-top!! The view form the balcony is somewhat obscured with shops but still quite cozy. I was disappointed that the jacuzzi in the pool was not working as I was looking forward to the hot jets to relieve sore neck muscles; however the "dial your speed" shower-head in room 412 was AMAZING!! We didn’t eat at the hotel as we would rather dine on an outside deck by the water. For the price of $155 a night, It wasn’t that bad as the balconies provided privacy for us to snuggle, watch the sunset and make great memories!!
reviews.title: Water views and comfy beds!

reviews.text: We had my daughter's wedding at the Radisson Plymouth Harbor this weekend, and the staff could not be nicer, professional and accommodating. Our package included a conference room for the girls to get ready, and then for them to take their breath and have some appetizers after they got back from the ceremony and pictures. Not one complaint from any of the guests - just raves. We also recommend their vendors - Barry's flowers, Kondietermeister Bakery, Harry Lee - DJ. We had a cash bar cocktail hour before the reception with cheeses and passed hoer d'ourves; and a buffet menu for 150 people. Our guests were never at a want for food or drink. People liked the ability to choose the type of food and quantity that they could eat.
reviews.title: Wonderful Wedding Venue!

reviews.text: Rooms were comfortable, beds very comfortable.
reviews.title: Great location, Friendly Staff

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night on business. Friendly and professional front desk staff greeted me and got me checked in quickly. The room, while not super fancy, was very clean and comfortable. My bed was a Sleep Number bed, so I could adjust it to my preference. The location of this hotel is perfect as it is right across from Plymouth Harbor, and easy walking distance to many restuarants and night spots. It was a great value for the priced I paid.
reviews.title: Okay

reviews.text: This hotel is showing its age. The hallways smell of chlorine. The rooms are somewhat dingy feeling. They could use a better dehumidification system in the hotel. The rooms smell like the pool too until the a/c runs for a little while. Or maybe you get used to it after a few minutes. The beds are "sleep member" but we had a hard time getting comfortable. it was like the old waterbeds where when one person moved the other person felt the wave in the bed. The bathrooms could use a better scrubbing we could see mold around the edges,
reviews.title: Good for the area
